other_tests.findings: Infiltration of the brain parenchyma by large atypical lymphoid cells, characterized by a diffuse and angiocentric pattern of involvement. Immunohistochemical staining confirmed B-cell characteristics.
Cerebrospinal fluid for cytopathological assessment was intended, but the procedure was not performed initially due to concerns of increased intracranial pressure.

Normal right and left ventricular function, estimated left ventricular ejection fraction of 67%, trace regurgitation of the mitral valve, and trace insufficiency of aortic, pulmonary, and tricuspid valves.
A large, enhancing mass in the medial aspect of the right frontal lobe and corpus callosum was detected, along with extensive vasogenic edema.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progressive resolution of abnormal enhancement in the corpus callosum and adjacent right frontal edema was observed after treatment.

other_tests.findings: Substantial 18F-fluorodeoxyglucose uptake in the enhancing mass in the region of the corpus callosum; no abnormal uptake elsewhere.
